snippet: Richard W. Pound, the leader of the doping investigation that led to Russia’s suspension from global track and field, sees little evidence that the country is doing enough to win reinstatement in time for the Olympics in Rio de Janeiro in August.
abstract: Richard W Pound, leader of World Anti-Doping Agency investigation that triggered Russia's suspension for doping and corruption, says Russia's track federation is unlikely to meet requirements for participating in 2016 Rio de Janeiro Olympics.
lead_paragraph: Richard W. Pound, the leader of the doping investigation that led to Russia’s suspension from global track and field, sees little evidence that the country is doing enough to win reinstatement in time for the Olympics in Rio de Janeiro in August.
